column2: an A.M. Eatery////If you are looking for a relaxing brunch
column3: I would suggest coming on a week day. Snooze brings out the brunch beasts on the weekend and brunch brings out the B in people. Parking and waiting is intense; as others have mentioned wait times range from 1-2 hours. The wait was 1 hour by 10 AM on Sunday. We managed to grab some seats by the bar
column4: which are first come first serve. (despite being mean mugged by another couple that wanted the seats too)
